intro: Actinanthus syriacus, commonly known as the Syrian starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. Actinanthus syriacus is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
